div.p: Y71/3695, unit 576, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Written by name?, and signed by M. Melbourne Botanic Garden

I have the honor to solicit that you will sanction the transfer of a sum of Fifty five pounds — £55 — from the Vote for Wages to Gardeners to the Vote for Stores, Stationery, Timber &c. This latter vote, which had already been considerably reduced in 1870, was lowered still more for 1871, and is inadequate to meet the demands of the Department. A considerable sum had to be transferred last year to the Wages vote, as heavy expenditure had been incurred in the beginning of the year before reductions now made; therefore I consider it but just, that the very much needed transfer of the above mentioned sum may be made from this vote.
I beg to enclose requisition for coals for the engine and hot houses, for paper &c. for the museum, and for flowerpots.
